revised_title: Enhancement of Ionization in Nitrogen by Excited Nitrogen Molecules and their De-Activation: A Study of Electric Strength and Excited Species
tldr: The authors investigated the effect of excited neutral nitrogen molecules on the ionization of pure nitrogen at room temperature. They found that the rate of ionization is considerably increased by admixing neutral molecules of electronically excited nitrogen. The electric strength of nitrogen at low pressure decreases as the population of excited molecules increases. The study provides insights into the spatial distribution, active life, and de-activation mechanisms of excited nitrogen molecules.
